Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Nestled alongside the Cache La Poudre River at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, Fort Collins is home to approximately 167,830 residents as of 2019. Colorado State University is the city’s largest employer and is Colorado’s second largest public university, enrolling 25,000 students each academic year.
Fort Collins is the business center of Northern Colorado. It is the area’s center for government, retail trade, the arts, health care, education, and employment with the region’s largest and best educated workforce.
A blend of innovative manufacturing and high tech firms, an educated population, research facilities, and a first-rate research university that emphasizes commercialization of research makes Fort Collins one of the nation’s most innovative and entrepreneurial communities.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 1999 Broadway is an exceptional Class-A office tower that remains one of Denver's most impressive downtown skyscrapers. It is situated between 19th and 20th streets on Broadway, within downtown Denver's Central Business District, and is conveniently accessible to Interstate 25 using one of several connecting arteries including Park Avenue Viaduct, 20th Street, Speer Boulevard or Broadway/Lincoln. It is directly adjacent to one of Denver's RTD light rail stations, which provides low cost transportation throughout downtown, connects with the 16th street mall shuttle, and the new southwest metro rail line. Amenities include: The Classic Cafe, a convenience store, card key access, 24-Hour security, a closed circuit monitoring system, on-site property management, full-time engineering staff and day porters, ample parking in a gated structure, valet parking service, ample surface parking, and spectacular mountain views. The building's unique triangular configuration takes advantage of beautiful western views, offers maximum efficiency for space planning and significantly more glass-line per floor than competing properties.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Located in the core of Denver's financial district at the corner of 17th Street and Tremont Street.  The 410 17th Street has easy access to the RTD's public transportation services and is a short walk from the Pavillions Retail Center and the 16th Street Mall shuttle.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The 24-story building features more than 433,000 square feet of office space.A spectacular exterior constructed of strong steel frame and light weight concrete cover metal decking with seven uniformly spaced concrete columns lining 17th and Tremont Streets. Red and charcoal brick pavers are set diagonal to the building and planters are placed along the building's perimeter. This building has manned security enhanced by a key card access system.

Granite tiles of black and taupe line the one-story lobby, which has 20' ceilings. A security desk is conveniently located in the center and houses a black, backlit building directory.The building features nine passenger elevators and a freight elevator.The HVAC consists of two chillers, four air handlers and a five-zone hot water heating system for maximum comfort and efficiency.The building has an adjacent seven-level garage that features more than 340 parking spaces.

The building offers some spectacular mountain, as well as downtown views.
Building hours are 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. Monday-Friday. Building also features concierge, conference facility and high-speed internet connections.

In 2010, this building was awarded LEED certification at the Gold level by the U.S. Green Building Council.

This building has been Wired Certified Gold. Wired Certified Gold means a building provides tenants with access to multiple high-quality internet service providers and a variety of cabling types including fiber. The infrastructure measures in place ensure connectivity sources are protected, redundant, and prepared for connectivity needs of future tenants as well. 


Internet Service Providers available:
Century Link-Fiber, TW Telecom-Fiber, Level 3-Fiber, Zayo Group-Fiber, Cogent-Fiber, Level 3-Fiber, XO Communications-Fiber, Comcast-Coaxial, Verizon-Copper

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The building offers excellent access to 17th & Champa, and is minutes from several major thoroughfares.

• Two blocks from Federal Courthouse
• At the corner of 17th & Champa
• In the center of Denver’s downtown financial district
• One block 16th Street Pedestrian Mall and the Free Mall Ride Shuttle
• One block from RTD Light rail station
• Colorado Business Bank located on the main floor/lobby of building

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The Vault is an iconic and historic building located at 17th Street/Champa in downtown Denver offering flexible floor plates, including highly improved spaces on the upper floors which are well suited to tech, creative, financial services, and law firm tenants. The ground floor is ideal for innovative food and beverage retailers, and features a grand lobby heralded as one of the top historic lobbies in city, along with large historic vaults on the lower level which can be unlocked for further potential. Tenants enjoy the best of the city's original business district and the nearby 16th Street Pedestrian Mall ($150M renovation underway) with over 40 cafes/restaurants, two dozen shops, as well as a MallRide shuttle bus and light rail station.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Market Center,is a collection of 5 brick and timber buildings built in the early 1880s. The original building uses reflect a time long past,including the Liebhardt-Lindner Building at 1624 Market Street to 1330 17th Street built originally for commercial use and converted into a hotel in the 1890s. Reborn in the early 1980s through a thorough renovation to office and retail uses,the multiple structures function as one continuous building from the brick-paved promenade at ground level. Located in the Lower Downtown(LoDo)historic district adjacent to Denver’s Central Business District(CBD),the buildings are adjacent to bus,light rail and bike share)with high walkability to other CBD office and services.
It should be noted there is 36,000 square feet of retail; 30,000 square feet at street level and 6,000 square feet of walk-down daylight space.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 1660 Wynkoop is ideally located in the historic Lower Downtown District, just across the street from the newly renovated Union Station.  This flourishing new development offers unsurpassed access to unlimited retail, dining, hotel and entertainment options as well as numerous employee transporation alternatives including the RTD bus and light rail system.  Within walking distance, diners can enjoy over 100 different restaurantas ranging from express food service to fine dining.  The building is located just blocks from Coors Field, the Pepsi Center, and the vibrant 16th Street Pedestrian Mall.  With ample covered parking, 1660 Wynkoop is easily accessible from both I-25 and Speer Boulevard.  1660 Wynkoop is professionally managed on-site by Steelwave with a day porter guaranteeing the best possible service to new and current tenants. New high-end lobby and common area renovations have recently been completed throughout the building.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 1601 Wewatta is located in the heart of Denver’s flourishing Union Station area and also offers instant walking access to the Highlands Neighborhood, Riverfront Park, Confluence Park, and countless amenities within the Lower Downtown district. With immediate access to housing, retail amenities and transit, 1601 Wewatta is a recruiting tool for tenants who want to attract and retain the smartest, most-talented employees. 1601 Wewatta is directly adjacent to Union Station, Denver’s premier multi-modal hub for light rail, commuter rail and bus transit. In addition to its strategic location in the center of Denver’s largest transportation gateway, This combination of world-class architectural design, functionality, prime location and immediate access to transit sets 1601 Wewatta’s tenants apart from their peers in an environment that will be at the cutting-edge forefront of true modern-day office space. 1601’s large, efficient floor plates with full-height 10’ glass provides multi-tenant or single-tenant users with the ability to horizontally or vertically integrate large spaces. Five outdoor terraces on three different floors as well as the large outdoor plaza designed with an “urban living room” concept provides Tenants with the opportunity to connect to the outdoor environment in an urban setting. 1601 also has 17,500 rentable square feet of street-level restaurant and retail space. Amenities include: a 38,000 SF Colorado Athletic Club on all of the 2nd floor, large 35,000 SF floor plates. The First Floor includes 2 restaurants-Public School and Wewatta Point - both with outdoor patio seating that spills out to the Building Plaza. Property also includes high-end plaza environment on 1st floor and sizeable landscaped outdoor terraces. Adjacent to Union Station. Easy access to downtown & I-25, climate controlled parking in 4 levels below the building, secure bike storage for 100+ bikes with complimentary men’s and women’s showers and lockers.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Denver Energy Center is comprised of two towers, Joule (1675-Tower 1) 382,752 square feet and Ohm (1625-Tower 2) 402,797 square feet totaling 785,549 square feet in Denver’s Central Business District.  The property is situated in downtown Denver and ideally positioned at the corner of 16th Street and Broadway.  The project is easily accessible from all of Denver and offers tenants direct access to nearby amenities including the 16th Street Mall and the Denver Pavilions.  

Denver Energy Center offers a full-service experience to its tenants and visitors from the moment one arrives at the building.  The on-site amenities include a start of the art conference/training center, a full-service fitness center with towel service, banks, bike storage, 24/7 security, premium secure parking, class A lobby, landscaped courtyard with ample seating and onsite property management.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
1900 16th recently added first floor retail locations for Potbelly Sandwich Shop, The Honor Society and Starbucks in the building. It is also located adjacent to many retail amenities that are within walking distance. Within a five block radius shoppers have access to numerous retailers, banking institutions, salons and spas and other specialty services. There are over 100 different restaurants located within a short walk of 1900 Sixteenth Street. Diners can experience everything from express food service to four-star dining. LoDo and the Central Platte Valley currently offer over 2,500 residential units of all sizes for rent or for sale. The neighborhood is the one of the fastest growing in the Denver metro area and offers a vibrant urban lifestyle. This location is unique with its immediate access to numerous recreational opportunities. Within a short walk of the project, there are several health clubs, direct access to the Cherry Creek Bike path and over 400 miles of trail system and the recently renovated Confluence Park which sits directly on the Platte River. 1900 Sixteenth Street is within five blocks of both Coors field and the Pepsi Center, while Invesco Field is nearly a straight shot down 15th Street. Other cultural amenities in the area include the Denver Performing Arts Center and the recently expanded Denver Convention Center. Business travelers have numerous hotel choices within a wide range of budgets in close proximity to 1900 16th Street.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Interlocken Crescent features Cherrywood and granite finishes, state-of-the-art HVAC system and fiber optics capability. There are two-color limestone floors with polished granite accents and tinted green glass window panels, cove ceilings, custom pattern-loop carpets, dramatic down lighting and cove lighting. It has Rocky Mountain views and 24/7 building access. Located next to the new Flatiron crossing mall, near numerous restaurants, retail, banking, park and business services, it is located on the RTD route.

Ideally located in the highly-desirable Interlocken Advanced Technology Environment along U.S. 36, the main thoroughfare linking Denver and Boulder 

As the tallest office structure in Interlocken, along with its sister building 380 Interlocken, the project offers panoramic views of the Rocky Mountains and is within walking distance to the Interlocken recreation area which provides jogging trails, volleyball courts, softball fields/soccer fields, tennis courts and open fields 

The site is contiguous to a ±2.9 acre lake surrounded by a ±3.7 acre park. A network of planned sidewalks allows users a direct connection to these landscape amenities 

Close proximity to the 392 room Omni Interlocken Hotel/Conference Resort and 27-hole championship golf course 

Parking ratio of 4.2:1000

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Coal Creek Business Park is a new technologically advanced, high image, corporate business park for corporations seeking a state of the art building system. It is centrally located in the high-tech Denver-to-Boulder business corridor on US 36.

The building has multi-colored brick and stone exterior skin with medium performance, 1" insulated tinted glazing.  It is outfitted with dual entrances, 2-story lobby with exterior lighting and 9' ceilings.  The building has separate service and dock entrances, fiber optic lines and a satellite yard is available.

Corporate Center 1 has Card key access, and has building signage available facing US-36.  It is close to restaurants, shopping, and the Interlocken Business Park, and is only 20 minutes from downtown Denver & Boulder.

• Located in the heart of Downtown Aspen, a city that thrives on year round activity
• Opportunity to join a bustling retail market alongside other luxury retailers
• Neighboring retailers include James Perse, Oliver Peoples, Valentino, Marcus, Prada, Ralph Lauren, and many more
• Nearby eateries include Kenichi, Spring Cafe, Silver City, JUS Aspen, 520 Grill, Zane’s Tavern, and Mezzaluna

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Aspen is home to activities through every season. With seven 14ers to take on during the summer, 673 acres to ski during the winter, and an average of 300 days of sunshine, Aspen doesn’t fail to keep any visitor or local busy. Aspen is home to world class outdoor activities, luxury resorts, and high-end shopping. The city offers approximately 50 lodging properties, 80 restaurants and bars, and 230 shops/boutiques. The average daily population in Aspen is 20,871 with a high season population of approximately 27,000. Aspen offers a number of events that attract both visitors and locals including: Aspen Music Festival, Food & Wine Festival, X-Games, and more.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Situated in Aspen’s downtown core between the highly desirable corridors of Hunter Street and Cooper Avenue, 534 E. Cooper Ave provides a premier office or retail environment to tenants.

The Hunter St facing location provides a fantastic branding opportunity in a newly renovated redevelopment that doubled its street presence for 2020. 534 E. Cooper’s divisible space boasts over 17,200 square feet on three floors and 166 feet of wraparound frontage.

Developers with long-term plans for redevelopment have shown vested interest in the city, identifying it as a prominent up-and-coming area. The fundamentals of the Aspen market are incredibly strong, with very low vacancy, low capitalization, and incredibly strong demand.
